image.altText: A closeup of two panting labradoodles with golden matted fur with round pink tongues hanging out.

props.synopsis: With Tasmania's government pledging it's "committed to improving animal welfare" in abattoirs, experts say all animal cruelty laws must be toughened or another "puppy farm" outrage will occur.

title.children: With labradoodles just the latest outrage, experts plead for tougher laws against cruelty in Tasmania

image.altText: A finger pressed into the gap under a wall where the foundation has crumbled.

props.synopsis: A GJ Gardner Homes franchisee may have been trading while insolvent since early 2020. Then came more than 1,000 pages of complaint data about poor and defective works — but it was still able to sign up new customers for four years.

title.children: Things were about to go horribly wrong with a house build. But no-one seemed to be listening

image.altText: A sign with LGH and emergency written on it.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man is charged with criminal code assault after a baby was taken to a Launceston hospital with serious injuries.

title.children: Man charged after baby treated for serious injuries at hospital

image.altText: Scott Roth addressing players during a basketball match.

props.synopsis: The coach of the Tasmania JackJumpers demands the National Basketball League to do more stop abuse of players and their loved ones on social media after online attacks were directed at a player's pregnant wife.

title.children: Comments turned off after online abuse of NBL player's wife

image.altText: A blonde and brunette women sit together, smiling for a photo. There are wine glasses on the table in front of them.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians go missing every year, so what's it like spending years grieving and searching for answers?

title.children: 'Predatory behaviour': Psychics accused of exploiting grieving families

image.altText: a man playing the poker machines

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government promised mandatory pokies pre-commitment cards with daily limits, but some advocates are worried the premier is walking the reforms back. Airlie Ward chats with state political reporter Lucy MacDonald.

title.children: Listen to TassieCast 🔊 Is the state backing away from nation-leading pokies reforms?

image.altText: A man with a white beard and hair  wearing a black t-shirt and jeans sits on rocks by the water.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Braddon independent MP Craig Garland says he has tested positive for cannabis at a roadside drug test, and police found a small amount of the drug in his car.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Tasmanian MP's postive roadside test for cannabis

image.altText: Shayna Jack in one-piece swimwear, goggles and cap mid-leap out of a pool

props.synopsis: From vilified "drug cheat" to Olympic gold: The story behind Shayna Jack's extraordinary return to the winner's circle.

title.children: 'They just wanted to prove I was a cheat': Olympian Shayna Jack speaks out against anti-doping system

image.altText: Two yellow bulldozers are parked beside white blades, one of which lies on the ground with a blurred image in the centre.

props.synopsis: Investigations have begun after a worker died in an incident at a wind farm construction project at Rokewood, west of Geelong in Victoria.

title.children: Man fatally crushed on wind farm construction site in Victoria

props.synopsis: A former Labor senator has been appointed as Australia's first anti-slavery commissioner. Follow live.

title.children: Former Labor minister appointed Australia's first anti-slavery commissioner

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Nats leader rejects backbench push to revisit net zero
Watch live: GG, PM to award Victoria Cross to Private Richard Norden

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: The treasurer will seek to burnish his diplomatic credentials in a speech on Monday, revealing that he has held about 150 meetings with foreign counterparts since Labor took government.

title.children: Australia won't be 'immune' from possible economic fallout of Trump presidency, Chalmers says

image.altText: Two firefighters pour water on a burning building in Ukraine at night.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says the West needs to bolster its aid to the country, while the Kremlin says it saw "positive signals" from the election of Donald Trump.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine launch record-breaking drone strikes as Kremlin eyes Trump's next move

image.altText: Australian Army bugler outside the Sydney Opera House which has poppies projected on the sails.

props.synopsis: People across Australia gather to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Australians mark 106th Remembrance Day with services honouring the fallen

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX been dragged down by mining stocks in response to a disappointing new financial rescue package in China, while three Resolute Resources executives, including the CEO, have been detained in Mali over a dispute with the government. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slides on 'disappointing' Chinese stimulus package, Resolute Resources executives detained in Mali, shares crash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX down 0.4%, Resolute Resources crashes on executives being detained in Mali
Resolute Mining CEO and two other employees detained in Mali

image.altText: A pumpjack oil well, with suburban development and a mountain in the background.

props.synopsis: The Azerbaijani government is accused of greenwashing as it prepares to ramp up oil and gas exports to the European Union.

title.children: Azerbaijan is an autocratic petrostate. So why is it hosting the COP29 meeting?

image.altText: A steel ladder on the side of an outdoor pool.

props.synopsis: Gastro cases explode in 12 months, with the cryptosporidiosis parasite causing a large number of children to get sick.

title.children: Gastro cases in Australia have exploded. What does that mean for children?

image.altText: Barbora Krejcikova looks down

props.synopsis: Tennis player Barbora Krejčíková calls for more professionalism in sports media after her appearance was criticised by Tennis Channel journalist Jon Wertheim.

title.children: 'This isn't the first time': Wimbledon winner calls for respect after journalist's comment about her looks

image.altText: Black and white photo of two men smiling standing behind nine small children, most of whom also smile.

props.synopsis: When school kids shouted that they saw a man with a gun, their teacher thought it was a prank. What followed was something the residents of a tiny town would never forget.

title.children: One Kombi van, 17 hostages and an outrageous ransom: The dramatic crime that took hold of a tiny Australian town

image.altText: woman takes a photo of three children eating watermelon

props.synopsis: The level of protection social media accounts set to private provide is sometimes misunderstood, experts say.

title.children: Why posting your child's photos on a private social media account is still risky

image.altText: A young mother sits on the floor holding a little boy, both smiling.

props.synopsis: After giving birth to Henry from her mother's donated womb, Kirsty Bryant began showing signs of organ rejection before she could have another child. Despite the change in plans, she feels "so lucky" to have her baby boy.

title.children: First Australian woman to give birth after uterus transplant undergoes hysterectomy

image.altText: A lady with pink hair stands in front a clearing of bushland where a blue tent stands in the background.

props.synopsis: Castlemaine is one of the 68 locations across Australia that have a rental vacancy rate less than 1 per cent. There are said to be 600 people actively needing a house in the town yet only 10 homes listed for lease online.

title.children: In a small Victorian town with a population of 20,000, there are only 10 homes available to rent

image.altText: a driver behind the wheel at sunset

props.synopsis: An elderly woman loses an appeal to get her driver's licence back after failing two driving tests, including one where she amassed 182 penalty points — 160 more than a fail mark.

title.children: 97yo woman appeals licence suspension after amassing hundreds of penalty points in driving tests

image.altText: A street view in Taiwan with stores in the background and a man in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Facing fierce competition in China amid a sluggish economy, e-commerce giant Alibaba's shopping platform Taobao is establishing a new front in the Singles' Day war in Taiwan.

title.children: Wallets 'bleed out' as the world's largest shopping festival kicks off

image.altText: Garry Conille stands in front of a podium wearing a navy blue suit and a red tie.

props.synopsis: The process of replacing the prime minister is likely to add even more turmoil to a rocky democratic transition process in the Caribbean nation.

title.children: Haitian PM fired after six months, marking more turmoil in democratic transition

image.altText: A composite image showing three writers and their book covers on a brown paper background

props.synopsis: The winner of the prestigious literary award — to be announced on November 12 — will take home $98,000 and receive a dramatic bump in book sales around the world.

title.children: 'I'd be gobsmacked if it won': Book experts dish on the Booker Prize shortlist

image.altText: Liam Payne holding a microphone singing on a stage in France

props.synopsis: Speaking towards the end of the awards show, Rita Ora becomes visibly emotional while paying tribute to the former One Direction singer.

title.children: Rita Ora pays tribute to Liam Payne at MTV Europe Music Awards

image.altText: A flag with the colours of the rainbow flying on a flag post.

props.synopsis: Proposed changes to the Racial and Religious Tolerance Act will balance individual rights, free speech and religious belief.

title.children: Proposed hate speech laws aimed at protecting the vulnerable spark mixed response

image.altText: A thick stand of cocos palms near the beach of West Island.

props.synopsis: A special shipment is set to arrive in the islands this month, after the collapse of the Cocos Co-Op — owner of the West Island supermarket  — left residents with dwindling supplies.

title.children: 'Where's the money gone?': Restocking remote supermarket just one hurdle facing administrators on Cocos Islands

props.synopsis: The shooting took place in Mexico's Querétaro state.

title.children: Gunmen shoot 10 dead, injure several others as wave of violent crime hits areas of Mexico

image.altText: Two boys in hoodies standing in a car park at night

props.synopsis: When a child isn't safe with their family, they are placed into the care of the WA government. But some of these children and their foster parents are shining a spotlight on conditions they say are putting youth back in harm's way.

title.children: Foster children, parents lift the lid on abuse, neglect in WA's child protection system

image.altText: A woman looks into the camera inside her home, with a framed photo of her son on the wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Samara Laverty wants to make sure what happened to her son Declan never happens to anyone else. But experts say ‘Declan’s Law’ could have unintended consequences which won’t make the community safer.

title.children: Declan Laverty was murdered by a man out on bail. Will tougher bail laws prevent another tragedy?

image.altText: Drone photo of small town surrounded by green and brown dirt.

props.synopsis: Behind Alpha's empty storefronts are the remnants of a once-bustling Queensland town with multiple industries and a thriving social scene. It's a familiar story across the country, but not everyone has given up hope.

title.children: Alpha once buzzed with 'balls and dances', but is now shrinking like many country towns

image.altText: A centenarian holds a photo of her young self while sitting her couch at home

props.synopsis: At 19, Margot McCormick quit working for her dad to join Australia's largest women's service branch — the organisation which paved the way for women to join the air force.

title.children: On Remembrance Day, 101-year-old Margot McCormick reflects on how she served Australia during WWII
